workout_file.description: Foundation training: Relatively low intensity ride with goal of spending a large proportion of the ride into Endurance Zone 2.
workout_file.name: Week 1.3 - Foundation

textevent.message: Welcome back to another Foundation workout in the 6-week Beginner FTP Builder!
We're going to start today with a progressive 10min warmup like usual.
Let's aim for a comfortable cadence here, and make sure you have your fan, towel, and fluids all ready to go!
That's 3min into it. Hopefully, the legs are starting to feel a bit looser, and your pedal stroke is becoming more fluid.
That's halfway through the warmup. Let's go through a rundown of what we have in-store today...
Today will be a progression of the foundation workout from earlier this week, and we're aiming for 5min today.
We'll repeat the 5 reps, with 2min between though...I'm not that mean after all :-)
Plan on also doing them at varied cadences and positions like previously.
However, overall, a very low key and relaxed day.
1min to go here, then we'll jump right into our first interval.
Take a couple of sips of fluid and shake out the upper body if you're holding any tension.
I want you to keep a low cadence for this first interval here, aiming for 70 RPM.
Okay, bring the cadence down, and let's use this first minute to adjust to the effort.
And remember, this is just over 1 complete pedal stroke per second.
Aim to keep your hands resting on the bars, shoulders relaxed, and keep a light grip.
That's 1min down. Now, let's aim to keep things smooth and steady.
Form check: Shoulders relaxed, elbows bent slightly, light grip on your bars. Great work!
Last minute! Continue to keep the cadence slow and keep driving those pedals.
There's the arch just ahead, keep going!
Excellent! Now, we'll take a couple of minutes easy.
Use this time to take a couple of sips of fluid, and a couple of deep breaths.
30sec to go, then we're back on for our 2nd interval.
This time, I want you to aim for a quick cadence of 95+ RPM for the interval.
Or about 1.5 pedal strokes per second. Start bringing the leg speed up here.
Okay, we're back on again, but this time I want FAST FEET!
Let's use this first minute to adjust to the effort again.
Great work so far! You may notice a higher heart rate at the faster cadence.
This is due to the increased metabolic demands placed upon your body at a quicker leg speed.
And also why you may notice a lower heart rate at slower leg speeds.
That's halfway!! Keep it up here, my friend! You're doing great!
A final-minute here. Don't let the cadence drop off now!
Homestretch!! Keep it up now!
Awesome! Bring the cadence back down to something more comfortable now, and let's recover for a couple of minutes.
Breathe and relax...
Okay, up next, we're going to do some positional work, and see how aero you can get.
So, no cadence target next whatever's comfortable.
But, I want you to use your drops, or aero bars, for the duration of this interval ideally...Ready?
All right, let's get into this here. Grab onto your drops, or get into your aero bars.
The goal is to hold this position for the entirety of the interval, but if you're uncomfortable, do what you can.
Good work so far. When you're working in this position, imagine shrinking down as low as you can get.
Try to minimize your frontal area to reduce your drag...Which will make you faster outdoors :-)
That's halfway! Are you still in position? Great job if you are, and if you aren't, no problem. Keep practicing.
A final-minute here. Try to get back into position, or keep it here for this last minute.
Get to that arch!
Good deal! We'll do more drills and intervals like that over the coming weeks to further improve your aero position.
Flexibility is a key factor there, so if you felt like you were struggling, doing some flexibility work will help.
This can be something as simple as a toe touch, or as complex as Yoga. Whatever floats your boat :-)
Next interval coming up in 30sec! This time we're going to alternate from a low cadence to a high cadence.
This will consist of 1min at 70 RPM, and 15sec at 100+ RPM.
Ready? We're starting at the low cadence first...
Okay, let's bring the cadence down nice and slow here. Drive those pedals from the hips.
In 10sec, I want you to make a SMOOTH transition up to 100+ RPM. Get ready.
Bring that leg speed up!
Good, now bring it back down to 70 RPM again, but keep in control here.
Ready to bring it back up again to 100 RPM? Remember, aim to make it smooth again here.
Back up! FAST FEET!
Excellent work! That's halfway through this one. Back to a slow cadence again.
FAST FEET!
Slow it down again. Steady as you go for this final rep!
Lift the leg speed again! GO GO!
Great work! We only have 1 interval left today. Take a few deep breaths and a sip of fluid here.
All right, the final effort is ahead of us. This time, we're going to be back up to a fast cadence the entire time.
So, just like before, I want you to aim for 95+ RPM for the entire 5min interval.
Ready? Start bringing the leg speed back up now.
Let's make this last interval happen! Bring the power back up and let 'er rip!
Quick form check: relax the shoulders, bend the elbows slightly, loosen your grip on the bars.
Halfway through! Make sure you're not bouncing or lurching back and forth on the saddle. Keep your backside planted.
Last minute! Excellent job with this so far!!
All right, there's the arch ahead again. Hit it!
Great work today and way to further progress your foundation work.
Laying the foundation now will allow your peak to be even higher later on.
We'll take a nice 10min cool down here to spin the legs out and return to baseline again.
Aim to take 24 hours between sessions, and make sure to refuel before your next workout.
We'll see you next time!
